tickerNews.title: HRUM: Acquisition of HPAL Smelter; Taking Stakes in Nickel Subsidiary Entities
tickerNews.content:
Harum Energy (HRUM) announced 3 corporate actions in close succession this week, each involving the takeover of shares in nickel companies through loan conversions. Here are the details:
- Acquisition of 51% Share in PT Blue Sparking Energy (BSE) HRUM through its subsidiary, PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN), acquired 1.04 million (51%) shares of BSE through a conversion scheme of part of a loan amounting to approximately US$206.2 million. Before this transaction, HRUM through THN did not have a stake in BSE. BSE itself is developing an HPAL project with a capacity of 67,000 tons of MHP nickel and 7,500 tons of MHP cobalt per year in the Weda Bay Industrial Park. The project is targeted to begin commercial operations in 2026.
- Taking New Shares in PT Harum Nickel Perkasa (HNP) HRUM subscribed to 8.48 million new HNP shares through a loan conversion scheme amounting to approximately 8.5 trillion rupiah or US$540 million. After this transaction, HRUM's ownership in HNP increased from 99.95% to 99.99%. This transaction was carried out in order to improve HNP's capital structure, as well as the development and expansion of HRUM's business activities in the nickel industry.
- Taking New Shares in PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN) HRUM, HNP, and a third-party company named PT Mahkota Emas Nickel (MEN) subscribed to 12.47 million new THN shares through a loan conversion scheme amounting to approximately 12.5 trillion rupiah or US$794.2 million. After this transaction, HRUM's share ownership in THN decreased from 39.58% to 22.27%. Meanwhile, HNP's ownership increased from 60% to 77.52%. MEN's share ownership decreased from 0.42% to 0.21%.
HNP and THN are HRUM's subsidiaries overseeing the nickel business. Since 2020, HRUM has conducted various acquisitions in the nickel sector through both companies. THN records holding 51% shares of PT Position and 99.99% shares of PT Infei Metal Industry. HNP holds 80.7% shares in PT Westrong Metal Industry.
Key Takeaway
We assess that only the BSE transaction provides a direct positive impact on HRUM's fundamentals, considering BSE is a new nickel asset for the company. Meanwhile, we assess the THN and HNP transactions do not provide a significant impact because HRUM's effective ownership in both does not change much post-transaction. Since announcing the BSE transaction on Monday (4/1) evening, HRUM's stock price has strengthened by +8.5% in the last 2 days.
The value of the loan conversion of approximately US$206.2 million into a 51% stake in BSE indicates a valuation for BSE reaching US$404.2 million or 6.4 trillion rupiah. Previously, in early October 2023, HRUM through THN had signed a loan facility agreement with BSE amounting to US$500 million for the development of the HPAL facility. Of this amount, US$300 million has been disbursed on October 17, 2023. Nevertheless, there is no information regarding the detailed investment cost of BSE's HPAL construction.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Gets US$511.45 Million Contract from SINI
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO): Petrosea announced that it has signed a term sheet for a mining services agreement with PT Pasir Bara Prima, a subsidiary of Singaraja Putra (SINI), worth US$511.45 million. The contract duration reaches 9 years until 2032. This contract is estimated to strip a total of 240 million bcm of overburden, with a coal production of 26.4 million tons.

tickerNews.title: TPIA signs a term loan facility agreement from Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) signed a bullet term loan facility agreement worth 4 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) with a tenor of 7 years. This loan is intended to increase the business under the umbrella of the company's infrastructure investment entity, PT Chandra Daya Investasi.

tickerNews.title: ACES targets +10% YoY sales growth in 2024
tickerNews.content: Ace Hardware Indonesia (ACES) targets sales growth of +10% Year-over-Year (YoY) in 2024, with a target for Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) growing by +7% YoY (compared to 2023 realization: +8.1% YoY). To achieve this target, ACES plans to open 15-20 new stores in 2024 with a capital expenditure (capex) allocation of 200-250 billion rupiah (compared to 2023 allocation: 300 billion rupiah). As of the end of 2023, ACES had 309 stores.

tickerNews.title: BNGA will distribute 2023 book year dividends
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) will distribute dividends for the 2023 book year amounting to approximately 3.1 trillion rupiah or approximately 122.7 rupiah per share. The ex-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is April 19, 2024, with payment on May 3, 2024. Referring to BNGA's stock price at the market close on Wednesday (3/4) at 2,080 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 5.9%.

tickerNews.title: ADMR aluminum supply agreement terminated by Hyundai Motor
tickerNews.content: Hyundai Motor (KRX: 005380) announced on Wednesday (3/4) that they had terminated the aluminium purchase agreement of 50-100 thousand tons per year from Adaro Minerals Indonesia, a subsidiary of Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO), at the end of 2023. The Director of ADMR, Wito Krisnahadi, confirmed this to Reuters and added that Hyundai decided not to renew the agreement after its term expired. Reuters reported that Hyundai's move was driven by pressure from K-Pop fan-based environmental activists who urged the company not to use metal supplies from coal companies.

tickerNews.title: BREN finalizes acquisition of Sidrap 1 and OMI, secures BBNI credit facility
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) through its subsidiary, PT Barito Wind Energy (BWE), has completed the acquisition of 99.99% shares in PT UPC Sidrap Bayu Energy (Sidrap 1) and PT Operation and Maintenance Indonesia (OMI). The total transaction value reached US$102.2 million. After this transaction, PT Barito Wind Energy owns the Sidrap Geothermal Power Plant (PLTP) with a capacity of 75 MW. BREN also announced that it has signed a credit facility agreement from Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) amounting to US$110 million, where US$70 million is allocated to finance the acquisition of Sidrap 1 and OMI, while the remainder is for financing BWE's general needs.

tickerNews.title: NCKL signs nickel ore sales agreement with associate entity ONC
tickerNews.content: Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL) together with its subsidiary, PT Gane Permai Sentosa, signed a nickel ore sales agreement with an associate entity, PT Obi Nickel Cobalt (ONC). The contract duration is for 1 year until March 28, 2025, with the sales volume not being announced. ONC itself is currently building an HPAL smelter with a capacity of 65 thousand tons of MHP nickel per year, targeting operations to commence in mid-2024.

tickerNews.title: INCO targets 70,800 tons of nickel matte production in 2024
tickerNews.content: Head of Communication Vale Indonesia (INCO), Bayu Aji, stated that the company targets nickel matte production of 70.8 thousand tons in 2024, not far different from the 2023 realization of 70.7 thousand tons.

tickerNews.title: Kpler notes increased thermal coal imports by China and India in March 2024
tickerNews.content: Commodity analysis firm, Kpler, noted that coal imports by China and India increased in March 2024. During that period, China imported 29.7 tons of coal (+29% Month-over-Month, +3.8% Year-over-Year), while India imported 15.21 million tons (+7.9% MoM, +13.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BNII will distribute 2023 book year dividends
tickerNews.content: Bank Maybank Indonesia (BNII) will distribute dividends for the 2023 book year amounting to 784.5 billion rupiah or 10.3 rupiah per share. The ex-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is April 17, 2024, with payment on April 30, 2024. Referring to BNII's stock price at the market close on Wednesday (3/4) at 258 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 4%.

tickerNews.title: PBID plans a 1:4 stock split
tickerNews.content: Panca Budi Idaman (PBID) plans to conduct a stock split with a ratio of 1:4. The final trading date for shares with the old nominal value is May 30, 2024. This plan will be discussed in the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) on May 13, 2024.
